thread.title: Freeport's Grand River Hall hosts family-friendly New Year's Eve | News | wrex.com
thread.title_full: Freeport's Grand River Hall hosts family-friendly New Year's Eve | News | wrex.com

author: Nathan Langley
title: Freeport's Grand River Hall hosts family-friendly New Year's Eve | News | wrex.com
text: FREEPORT, Ill. â€” For families looking to ring in the new year together, Freeport's [Grand River Hall](https://grandriverhall.com/) hopes to provide safe fun. Grand River Hall, an event space in the Stephenson County community, hosts [Family Night for New Year's Eve](https://www.facebook.com/GrandRiverHall/posts/874797144646135?ref=embed_post). Family-friendly festivities are abound as a magician, local caricature artist, disco dance party and more await the night. And for grownups concerned of kiddos staying up late, the celebration holds its own ball drop at 10 p.m. "Plenty of time to head home, cuddle up to ring in the New Year with the ones you love or get yourself a sitter and head back out for a night on the town," states the [event](https://www.facebook.com/GrandRiverHall) on the early ball drop. No outside food or drinks are allowed, but light snacks and purchasable drinks can be found inside the hall. Likewise, all children must remain accompanied by an adult at all times, The Grand River Hall rings in the New Year from 6 p.m. to 10 p.m. on Sunday, Dec. 31; doors open at 6 p.m., seating for Johnny Silver Magic opens from 7 p.m. until 8 p.m. and remaining festivities run from 8 p.m. to 10 p.m. The Freeport event space is located at 101 S Liberty Ave #1, Freeport.
